guild.description:
All the articles, guides and memes you could want to perfect your role of the Traditional Husband. The perfect complement to the +TradWife. 

What does it mean to be a Traditional Husband? 
How to perfect your manliness? 
How to look after your wife? 
How do you best go about drawing boundaries? 
How to excel at being the provider and protector?

post.title: we must return to this as men and a society

body: Hey guys I need help.  I have a goal of becoming a father and a husband but I have some issues I need to overcome and because there is most likely a fair number of older christian married men, I figured I'd ask here for advice.  Because a very wise man once told me that you should take advice from people who are in a position you want to be in.  I need help quitting porn and masturbating, quitting weed and alcohol, and attending church/reading the bible.  I know that God will provide if I do these things and honor him but I need advice from people who are in the position to look back and give first steps.
body_html: Hey guys I need help. I have a goal of becoming a father and a husband but I have some issues I need to overcome and because there is most likely a fair number of older christian married men, I figured I'd ask here for advice. post.title: we must return to this as men and a society

body:
Well it became "uncool" to be a virgin, because the emotionally disturbed girls who didn't know how to appreciate and take care of their own bodies wanted to shame and destroy everyone else to equal the playing field.

When they grow up, no one wants to commit to them or build a life with them, so they again want to shame you and try to destroy what you have and they can't comprehend or obtain. The "career oriented" ones may also be against a homemaker because it's the life they sacrificed to go pay taxes and trade their youth for money and a status that men care little about.

Irresponsible men who won't commit to women or build a stable life are equally to blame. And the powers that be created this culture, and the men and women behaving like this are just led right along like thoughtless sheep.

post.title: we must return to this as men and a society

body:
Humans are motivated primarily by their desires and their fears. To maximise motivation you have to maximise desire and fear. The best way I have found to do that is with Jordan Peterson's Self Authoring program - it's designed to help you crystallise and make visceral what you want and what you are scared of which in turn makes you motivated.

Here's a nice explanation of the Self Authoring program which seems like it was made for you:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LGuqEGUIp3g

And here's the program itself:

https://www.selfauthoring.com/

Hope that helps!

post.title: we must return to this as men and a society

body:
Exodus 20:3 Thou shalt have no other gods before me.

Why would you ever pray to anything other than The Lord your God? Ya I know, you are catholic or orthodox or whatever and they filled your mind with their traditions and perverted view of scripture, but that is not an excuse for anyone that has access to The Bible. Do not pray to saints, or angels, or mary, for whatever reasons you were told. None of that comes from scripture. And don't google the scripture your religion has warped to condone this behavior. This is all you need:

Philippians 4:6
Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

body: Jordan is not going to lead you closer to God. When life presented him with challenges last year due to his wife's illness, he also turned to drugs to cope with his problems. And this was after he created the selfauthoring program and all of that. Why invest time into this person when you can study the bible and listen to believers with the Holy Spirit?

post.title: we must return to this as men and a society

body:
You said you wanted to quit weed and alcohol, so I assumed you didn't want to go from one drug to another to solve a problem. And he didn't just do "prescription drugs" (drugs), he got so addicted to his tranquilizers he wanted to be put into a coma in order to deal with the withdrawal symptoms. 

You really can't do both, an unbeliever is going to give conflicting advice than the bible gives, and you only have the time to study one or the other in any given moment. The Bible is perfectection and can solve any problem no matter how complex or specific, and a man can only give you his opinion, which in this case couldn't solve his own emotional problems or substance dependence.
body_html:
You said you wanted to quit weed and alcohol, so I assumed you didn't want to go from one drug to another to solve a problem. And he didn't just do "prescription drugs" (drugs), he got so addicted to his tranquilizers he wanted to be put into a coma in order to deal with the withdrawal symptoms.

You really can't do both, an unbeliever is going to give conflicting advice than the bible gives, and you only have the time to study one or the other in any given moment. The Bible is perfectection and can solve any problem no matter how complex or specific, and a man can only give you his opinion, which in this case couldn't solve his own emotional problems or substance dependence.

post.title: we must return to this as men and a society

body:
>Humans are motivated primarily by their desires and their fears. To maximise motivation you have to maximise desire and fear.

The other commenter said this. This is true for unbelievers that do not have the Holy Spirit, they are motivated by their fleshly desires, and the fear associated with sinning against their conscience. 

Is this how you want to structure your life? By listening to what unbelievers do to manipulate their flesh in a vessel with a dead spirit? The Holy Spirit has nothing to fear but God, and it desires righteousness and living the life that God intended for us.

Advice that unbelievers give one another, is not applicable to you.

body: Your mentality of those things is what drives you to them. People crave sweets because they‚Äôve crafted both that narrative and habit in their head. By consciously setting those frameworks you can create new narratives and habits. For example, if you want to start reading the Bible, tell yourself beforehand ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to go read the Bible‚Äù. If you want it to be even more effective add qualifiers, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to go enjoy reading the Bible‚Äù. Try doing this with everything you do and see just how much your pre-perception of it changes your experience
body_html: Your mentality of those things is what drives you to them. People crave sweets because they‚Äôve crafted both that narrative and habit in their head. By consciously setting those frameworks you can create new narratives and habits. For example, if you want to start reading the Bible, tell yourself beforehand ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to go read the Bible‚Äù. I have a goal of becoming a father and a husband but I have some issues I need to overcome and because there is most likely a fair number of older christian married men, I figured I'd ask here for advice. Because a very wise man once told me that you should take advice from people who are in a position you want to be in. I need help quitting porn and masturbating, quitting weed and alcohol, and attending church/reading the bible. I know that God will provide if I do these things and honor him but I need advice from people who are in the position to look back and give first steps.

post.title: we must return to this as men and a society
